conclusion: To determine the height H at which the fire extinguishing projectile hits the high-rise building, we need to analyze the projectile motion.
The initial velocity v_0 is given as 50 m/s at an angle θ = 53°.
Horizontal component of velocity: v_{0x} = v_0 cos θ = 50 * 0.6 = 30 m/s
Vertical component of velocity: v_{0y} = v_0 sin θ = 50 * 0.8 = 40 m/s
The horizontal distance L is 60 m.
The time t to cover the horizontal distance L can be found using the horizontal component of velocity: t = L / v_{0x} = 60 / 30 = 2 s
Calculate the vertical position at time t: y = v_{0y} * t - (1/2) * g * t^2 = 40 * 2 - 0.5 * 10 * 2^2 = 60 m
The height H at which the projectile hits the building is the vertical position y calculated above: H = 60 m
The height H above the ground at which the fire extinguishing projectile hits the high-rise building is 60 m.
